# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/token.py
@source-hash: fc76ed1a1cbdb2c9
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:10:08Z

## Purpose
Auto-generated Python token constants module defining numeric identifiers for all Python language tokens used by the tokenizer and parser. Part of LLDB's Python runtime, provides standardized token identification for lexical analysis.

## Key Constants
- **Token IDs (L6-75)**: Comprehensive enumeration of Python language tokens from ENDMARKER (0) to N_TOKENS (68)
  - Basic tokens: NAME, NUMBER, STRING, NEWLINE, INDENT, DEDENT
  - Operators: PLUS, MINUS, STAR, SLASH, etc. with compound assignment variants
  - Delimiters: LPAR, RPAR, LSQB, RSQB, LBRACE, RBRACE, COLON, COMMA
  - Modern Python features: ASYNC, AWAIT, f-string tokens (FSTRING_START, FSTRING_MIDDLE, FSTRING_END)
  - Parser-specific: ERRORTOKEN, ENCODING, TYPE_COMMENT, TYPE_IGNORE

- **NT_OFFSET = 256 (L77)**: Threshold separating terminal tokens from non-terminal grammar symbols

## Key Data Structures
- **tok_name (L79-81)**: Reverse mapping dictionary from token values to names, dynamically built from module globals
- **EXACT_TOKEN_TYPES (L84-133)**: Direct mapping from exact token strings to token IDs for precise operator/delimiter matching

## Utility Functions
- **ISTERMINAL(x) (L135-136)**: Determines if token ID represents terminal symbol (< NT_OFFSET)
- **ISNONTERMINAL(x) (L138-139)**: Determines if token ID represents non-terminal grammar symbol (>= NT_OFFSET)  
- **ISEOF(x) (L141-142)**: Checks if token represents end-of-file marker

## Dependencies
- Auto-generated by Tools/build/generate_token.py (L2)
- Standard Python tokenization infrastructure

## Architectural Notes
- Bidirectional token resolution: numeric IDs to names via tok_name, exact strings to IDs via EXACT_TOKEN_TYPES
- Extensible design with __all__ dynamically populated from tok_name values
- Clear separation between terminal/non-terminal symbols using NT_OFFSET threshold
- Supports modern Python syntax including async/await, f-strings, type annotations
